body: Can you please provide the full stack trace for the error.

Added to the original comment.

The reason for the failure is [here](https://github.com/cakephp/i18n/blob/master/I18n.php#L79) which triggers if Cache is installed, which in my project, it is. However, I am not using Cake core, just the ORM, so I don't have this cache key configured anywhere.

Validator tries to use i18n only if `cakephp/i18n` is installed. Neither `cakephp/orm` or `cakephp/validation` have it as a hard depedency. Do you explicitly have `cakephp/i18n` as a dependency in your app?

PR #10438 added it as a requirement. I think it should be reverted back. It's required by only `Validation::localizedTime()` and those who want to use that method can explicitly install the `cakephp/i18n` package.

An undo on that front would be good for my use case, but I think the problem is bigger than that. 

Those people who want to use that method will then still run into my problem if they want to use these packages without Cake core. The Cake core problem in i18n needs to be addressed - perhaps by checking if the configuration value exists, and using defaults if not, rather than breaking, or by simply providing a clearer error message or a link to instructions on how to set this required config value when not using the whole framework.

Anyway, any chance for a fix being applied today and released, or should I just better revert to an older version?

issue.title: Remove cakephp/i18n as a dependency for cakephp/validation.

repository.name: cakephp
repository.description: CakePHP: The Rapid Development Framework for PHP - Official Repository

body: Also note that the above problem will be apparent only if Cache is installed. So this problem will fly under the radar if the packages are being used outside the framework and without cache, but as soon as Cache is in there too, things will blow up because it keeps looking for that key.

> An undo on that front would be good for my use case, but I think the problem is bigger than that.

I have opened PR #10884 to this effect.

> Those people who want to use that method will then still run into my problem if they want to use these packages without Cake core. The Cake core problem in i18n needs to be addressed - perhaps by checking if the configuration value exists, and using defaults if not, rather than breaking, or by simply providing a clearer error message or a link to instructions on how to set this required config value when not using the whole framework.

The `I18n` class does check and use caching only if relevant class is available. So I think it's a matter of updating [readme](https://github.com/cakephp/i18n/blob/master/README.md) of `cakephp/i18n` stating that proper cache configuration is required to be done.

> Anyway, any chance for a fix being applied today and released, or should I just better revert to an older version?

The next bugfix release for 3.4 is scheduled this weekend. So you can wait for that (assuming the related PR gets merged) or you can revert back to older version :)

@ADmad:
> you can revert back to older version :)

Unfortunately, this isn't possible without clumsy hacks because the version constraints are using carets instead of tildae, which means the Validator will always be pulled in as 3.4.9, even if I constrain ORM and Cache to something like `~3.3.1`.

Edit: I say "clumsy hack" because requiring a sub-dependency like Validation as a fixed version (3.4.3 in this case) to avoid this issue is not hard, but is clumsy and does incur some tech debt.

Then sit tight for potentially couple of days for a new release or just setup the expected cache config by referring to the [manual](https://book.cakephp.org/3.0/en/core-libraries/caching.html) :smile:

I've hard-constrained Validation to 3.4.3 for now as I needed to get it working asap. This document doesn't seem to make it clear how to configure the Cache for `_cake_core_` outside of the framework's context - could you provide some additional instructions on that page for such use cases? In particular, the Cache Config document references several values that aren't needed or used in my implementation, since I only use the ORM - I'm wondering about the minimal configuration required to make it work.
Refer to the examples shown below the statement "You can also configure Cache engines at runtime". You need to do same for `_cake_core_` key and modify the options as per your needs.
Please hop on to our IRC or slack channels if you need further help.
